body:

> Amen. A fed tank should not die in 3 seconds from an equally fed carry assuming they built correctly.

I think this would have sufficed for him particularily.

1: Ninja Tabi's. +25
2: Iceborn Gauntlet (over Trinity Force) +60
3: Randiun's Omen +70
4: Frozen Heart +100
5: Thornmail +100
6: Ohmwrecker / Sunfire Cape +50/45

So this is about +400 Armour, not including Runes or Masteries, which could theoretically see you advance up to 470 Armour. Yeah I know that seems like a lot. Sure there's only 1,000 Health added to this, but you would have so much Armour that even with the Last Whispers your opponents have, you would STILL have 72% damage reduction. So slightly over a 1/4 of their damage would actually be affecting you.

Absolutely ensure that you have 21 points in Defense, with points into Critical Strike negation.
I mean he might survive the adc, but he would have no mr so he would die regardless from the others.

In this game the full armor build would work. In general it would not. Plus Yasuo ignores half of bonus armor anyway.

if you didn't see it's not a fed tank. Nothing is fed when it's late game and everyone has 6 items and I wouldn't really call you a tank when you only have 2 items against what you died against which is the enemy adc's which are suppose to counter tanks and are good late game especially twitch. Also tanks do more then just tank that would be stupid. They also cc and do other things volibear specifically is suppose to snowball the early game in the jungle or lane stomp his opponent so that it's a 4v5 and win easily and quickly.

So when you have a champion that is suppose to be used to win early against a very very late game team with twitch,yasuo,poppy,rengar all who are shutdown easily for the easy early game win. The nerf to yasuo was to his early game base health so that he had a harder time in lane but that doesn't matter if you let him get 6 items in the late game with a late game team. All these people are ad and if you want to call yourself a tank don't buy only 2 items against armor when your agaisnt an all ad hyper carry comp especially when your more of an early game tank.

Also we don't know how he died. Did he get caught out? Did he run in like an idiot and get hit with everything it looks like it considering he got hit by nami wave and poppy and twitch bork and poppy usually goes into the enemy team to dive. Also he has a thornmail so even though he didn't do a thing and had almost no armor defense items against the best late game tank melters he still did a lot of damage to twitch with thornmail. and then the other people in his comp like rengar and yasuo can be completely countered with exhaust. and as said against a team like that your not suppose to let them get 6 items the game is suppose to end before that.

Most tanks are tanks because of there kits so like gnar for his passive or poppy because of her ult that lets her live for like 7 seconds and do tons of damage.

also 4 seconds is a long ass time to be alive. Play vayne and get hit by a cc like annie flash tibbers or just some random cc and see how long you live even without much hitting you and if volibear flipped twitch he would probably die. Watch ziggs ult hit you for 60% of your hp while having more long range abilities that both zone and do a lot of damage to your team. so when against a late game team that does all ad with only 2 armor items as an early game tank with no abilities to gap close other then flash 4 seconds is a long time he almost got the twitch he had to be real close to get borked by him and it's amazing he got close with nami and poppy peeling for him and even then he got close so those 4 seconds don't look long he almost got the adc in a cc that would most likely kill him and he forced the poppy to not dive your adc but peel for hers and forced nami abilities essentially with an early game tank that is suppose to snowball and win early he almost killed a late game adc hyper carry against a late game hyper carry team that deals all ad damage with only 2 armor items and he diverted the attention of your whole team to do so. and if tanks die fast think of how fast everyone else dies in that same 4 seconds what was your team doing? Probably still dieing considering your against a late game hyper carry team but if your team comp was the same they would do a lot to the enemy in those 4 seconds and even though he still died that thornmail would still do a considerable amount of damage I mean think of the damage done to twitch sure he has some lifesteal but if volibear had more armor then twitch would have taken way more damage and remember how many champions like ziggs ult does 60% of adc health that itself would be enough to litterally kill him sure the twitch has a banshee's veil but that's easily popped and there's a reason people generally take QSS over banshee's veil.

Tanks are in theory... 

Supposed to initiate the fight, and get out just before they die. Tanks should be able to do this, not get melted from 800 range by an ulting Twitch.

They need to buff tank only items, not things like Zhonya's or Athenes that have offensive capabilities as well.

They need like, an item that does the same of Alistars ultimate, but somehow regulate it so that it is not Overpowered on like assassins. Because that kind of idea can go wrong, anybody build on that?
Twitch had 22 kills, at that point he is SUPPOSED to murder an entire team with his ult.
Yes, he is supposed too. But he isn't supposed to kill the tank in 5 seconds.
Twitch barely dealt 2k damage (all AA damage shows up as his ultimate). For all we know Yasuo and Rengar could have dealt the rest of the damage.

I also will stand by the fact that I am not complaining about Twitch as a whole. Yes, obviously the whole enemy team participated, what OP wants to get across more less, if I understand. Is that tanks die too quickly in general. HELL! It's even a Voli, that passive is amazing, and he still died in 4 seconds.

Tanks need lovings.

EDIT: Also, what's the point of going tank anyway. Pick Irelia honestly, slap a tri-force on her and she can kill an ADC almost instantly. But she is a bruiser...

Though this doesn't apply to late game and if you let a twitch a poppy and a yasuo and a rengar reach late game your going to lose and it's no suprise that a twitch can deal 2k damage in 4 seconds even to a tank especially since this particular tank is suppose to snowball his team early with either ganks or cheese his lane opponent and snowball that way he is an early game tank with only 2 ad defensive items. against about the most late game oriented and ad focused team you can get. Volibear passive heals me.

Let's see. If i play veigar, in the 47th minute i should have roughly 200 bonus ap from Q, and a full build. Roughly 1100 AP. That means that i can utterly delete two players under 2.5 K hp in 1.2 second. Compared to that, living full 5 seconds while being focused is not bad. The fact that you soaked up 4K damage and your team still lost, well that's bad. 

The problem was, It's an Annie + Orianna + Tristana + Shaco + Volibear team. You have two form of engage, Shaco walking into the enemy team invisible with an orianna ball on him, or an Annie flash + Tibbers. You were against a poppy (who's a late game terror), with a Shaco (who is pretty much either a splitpusher, or die one for one late game, and volibear, who is also famous for his poor late game (He scales with HP well, but every other scaling of his is poor). 

In short, you had a team that had pretty much 0 engage, against a nami who can ult and slow you all, and a twitch who can kill all of you while you walk towards him. I'd be suprised if you won that game.

He didn't die from Thornmail because he had ArPen and MR. 30% of 1783 is 534.9, 267.95 after roughly 100 MR.

Also, your proof shows more like working as intended, tbh - Twitch is the highest damage AD carry of them all, bar Vayne and Kog vs REALLY high HP targets. And that is a full-build Twitch against a **mixed resistances bruiser** with two Armor items. You'd probably have lived longer if you had Frozen Heart and Tabi instead of Triforce and Merc Treads.

You forgot that Thornmail returns the damage received before reductions.

I'm going to assume he's got 72% damage reduction, since LW pierces 35% of that, approximately 35% damage reduction. Divide the damage received by the penetration and then multiply the armour reduction beforehand.

So, not to make matters worse.

But Twitch dealt approximately 3,500 damage in physical damage before reductions, 30% of that is 1,050~.

You took the focus of 4-5 people and lived for 4.5 seconds.

That is pretty fucking good.

The sad thing was, I wasn't focused.

The twitch has a line attack with R, so that just happened to hit me.

They also had a yasuo, AOE damage

Where did the rest of the damage come from? I'm only seeing about 55% of the damage dealt to you. 

Be nice if recap worked better. 

It looks like you got focused down hard, the enemy team blew a lot on you. Meaning you had to of absorbed a lot of cooldowns that should make it easier for your team to take advantage of. 

My question would be where is the rest of your team? I assume Nami/Rat combo did a lot of damage while providing a lot of disengage for the rat. 

Don't get me wrong, take itemization isn't the best. But we're not getting all of the right data here. No champion outside of invulnerability effects should survive more than 5 seconds of focus-fire from a whole team. 

Judging by the team comp, focusing you down was probably the right choice either way. 
You were the most likely one to bring Ori's ball into the enemy team. 
If they could initiate before Annie could they would overall win every time. Even then, your team doesn't have much to really do anything about it. 

Overall your team just didn't have a way to handle their team outside of a flash tibbers or something. You were the 2nd largest threat behind Annie in a teamfight. And i wouldn't be surprised if Rengar took one of the squishes out while you were getting take out by the rest. The fact it took this much focus to kill you in 4 seconds should say something. Your team just couldn't punish them for blowing so much on you. 

That's also why Voli really isn't played at the top. Everything he does is very transparent. Making it easy to deal with him without giving his team an advantage.
